body:
**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

Clear configuration, at step 3/7 after selecting the Plex Server, the "Next Step" button has a forbidden action. 

Error: Error fetching Plex Users
Error: Error fetching Plex libraries

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Docker container on Synology NAS
 - Browser: Safari
 - Version 18.3

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.
author: jrodmonaco

comments.body: Duplicate #122

title: Best configs?
body:
I am still playing with it since tmdb can be hard to tweak

Threshold 7
Votes 50
Search size i am still confused by, i put 50. Does it mean the amount of “ recommendations” tmdb show that suggestarr will look at? So if put 5 for example it will look at the first 5 only? Still not sure
author: king8084

comments.body:
Hi! The threshold refers to the minimum percentage of ratings to consider. For example, if SuggestArr finds a related movie with a threshold rating of 50, but you set it to 70, SuggestArr will simply skip that result. The same applies to the number of votes. If you set a minimum of 50 votes, the content must have at least 50 votes on TMDB with the minimum rating you specified.

So, don’t set the minimum vote count or rating threshold too high, or SuggestArr might not find any available content to suggest.
Yea the first two are clear. The search size is what im nkt sure what it means. Can you pls clarify it?

> Yea the first two are clear. The search size is what im nkt sure what it means. Can you pls clarify it?

Apologies for the misunderstanding! Yes, you're correct. If you set it to 5, only the first 5 recommendations will be considered as potential requests to be sent to Overseer/Jellyseer.

title: [BUG] Cannot request movies at all
body:
I have been experimenting with changing many of the settings in the Configuration to try and get a reasonable amount of suggested movies/shows, but I realized it hasn't ever once returned a movie suggestion.  Lots of tv shows were requested, though.  So I changed the settings to be the most wide open, and still no movies were requested.  Something seems to be amiss, requesting tv shows works fine but I cannot get it to request a single movie.

Nothing jumps out in the log.  There are some messages at the top about "Failed to retrieve metadata for item".  But I see it successfully fetch the recently watched content from all my Plex users.
There are a few lines that say "Error while processing item: 'tmdb_id'", but I saw that in another issue that was closed.
I see it reject various movies that do not match my very loose criteria (rejecting movies older than 1980).

I'm still new to this, maybe there is something that happens when I run this repeatedly, like if it's perhaps skipping some results that it already fetched in the now dozen or so times I've run this.  I guess I see just a few lines in the log about "Skipping... already requested or downloaded", but that doesn't explain why I'm not getting a single movie request.

Appreciate any help, as a new user it's possible I'm doing something silly, or even that we're not supposed to run this app repeatedly.
author: yroyathon

comments.body: This issue has been automatically closed due to inactivity.
Automatically closed after 5 days of inactivity.

title: [REQ] Filter Viewing History by User
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently, SuggestArr pulls viewing history for all users on the linked media server. This tool is more useful when executed on a user-by-user basis.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
During the configuration process, provide the ability to filter the scope of the sampled viewing history by media server user. Only provide recommendations based on the selected user(s) viewing history.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
N/A

**Additional context**
N/A
author: sameleff

comments.body: Hi @sameleff, I’ve just published the update in the `nightly` tag, and I’d really appreciate your feedback to ensure everything is functioning as expected!

Cool! It does seem to be filtering requests now on a particular user. Strangely, when it displays of users to include, a few of them (not all) are duplicated and show up twice. When I click a box for a particular user, the program selects the duplicated box as well. Looks like there is a bug in the method to display the list of users, but the functionality appeared to work.

title: General Questions
body:
I have a few questions about functionality:

1. How exactly does the recommendation engine work? Which user's viewing history is used when generating a list of media to recommend against (i.e. the plex admin, all plex users, Overseerr admin, Overseer local user if configured)? Are user ratings taken into account?
2. I was only able to connect to my Plex server via http (insecure) connections. In other apps (e.g. Overseerr, I have been able to connect via https). Will https be enabled in the future?
3. I like the step-by-step GUI, but once configured it would be nice to be able to edit each individual config rather than stepping through the sequence again from the beginning.
author: sameleff

comments.body:
Hi! Thank you for your interest and for the thoughtful questions about SuggestArr’s functionality. I’ll address each point:

1. Recommendation Engine: SuggestArr generates recommendations by analyzing the viewing history of all users on the media server. For each user, it retrieves recently viewed content to suggest similar media. Currently, user ratings aren’t factored into the recommendation process, but this could be a future enhancement.
2. HTTPS Support for Plex: At the moment, SuggestArr supports only HTTP connections for Plex. However, HTTPS support is on my roadmap. I plan to investigate further to identify the cause behind the current SSL limitation for Plex connections.
3.  Configuration Management: I’m glad you appreciate the step-by-step setup interface! I'm already working on making the configuration more flexible, allowing users to adjust individual settings without needing to restart the entire setup process.

Thank you again for the feedback, and I hope you're enjoying SuggestArr!

1. Is there a way to restrict which users SuggestArr considers within its recommendation scope? If not, this would be a good feature request candidate. Each user may have different tastes, so one recommendation engine isn't a good match (among other reasons). Also, could the current behavior explain the duplicate recommendations from #74 ? I also experienced this and wasn't sure why, but if SuggestArr pulls viewing history for each user individually and makes recommendations, then if two users have similar tastes it may recommend the same item? Obviously if it combines viewing history from all users before attempting to create issues then that would not explain #74.

Thanks for all the replies - and truly, this is an awesome app. This feature (automatic recommendations based on watch history) is a major gap with a self-hosted server. Definitely exciting!

Thank you for your detailed feedback and kind words! 😊

Currently, SuggestArr doesn’t have a feature to restrict recommendations to specific users, but it’s a great idea and definitely aligns with enhancing user customization. Implementing a way to filter recommendations based on user preferences or specific user histories would indeed help tailor the results better.

To clarify, SuggestArr is designed to check for existing requests before creating a new one, so theoretically, it should avoid duplicates even if multiple users have similar watch histories. However, it seems that in some cases this doesn’t work as expected, which could lead to duplicate recommendations.

I’ll need to investigate why the duplicate check isn’t always catching these cases. If you have any specific details about the conditions or patterns where duplicates appear, feel free to share them.

title: [REQ] Ability to monitor only the first season of TV
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When a new TV show is added all seasons are monitored which will download everything before knowing if I will like it.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Ability to select what to monitor:

- first episode
- first season
- last season

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I think it could be done in overseer to monitor only some parts of the show when added, but everything will be partially added. I want everything monitored when adding manually in overseer, but partially monitored when added by suggestarr.

**Additional context**
-
author: gbcatrinoiu

comments.body:
> **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** When a new TV show is added all seasons are monitored which will download everything before knowing if I will like it.
> 
> **Describe the solution you'd like** Ability to select what to monitor:
> 
> * first episode
> * first season
> * last season
> 
> **Describe alternatives you've considered** I think it could be done in overseer to monitor only some parts of the show when added, but everything will be partially added. I want everything monitored when adding manually in overseer, but partially monitored when added by suggestarr.
> 
> ## **Additional context**

Hi! Thank you so much for the suggestion. I've looked into it, and while I couldn’t find a way to request just a single episode via Overseer, I’ve added a feature to control the number of seasons requested. You’ll now see a new input field where you can specify the number of seasons to monitor:

- Leaving it blank will request all available seasons.
- Entering "1" will monitor only the first season.
- Entering "3" will monitor the first three seasons.

This should give more flexibility over how much content is initially requested. What do you think? If you’re available, I’d really appreciate your help testing this on the `nightly` tag!

Thanks again for your support!

Hi! I tested it and it works well, adding only the first or the first couple of seasons. On second thought selecting only the first episode might even be too much, so it is perfect. Great work and thanks for implementing it!

Not related to this feature req but I noticed that if one movie/tv show is already requested in overseer by another user and requestarr adds it as well, it is then marked as added by requestarr user.

Doesn't make more sense to keep the original user as the requester?

> Leaving it blank will request all available seasons.

> Entering` "1" will monitor only the first season.

> Entering "3" will monitor the first three seasons.

> This should give more flexibility over how much content is initially requested. What do you think? If you’re available, I’d really appreciate your help testing this on the nightly tag!


Sorry to jump in into a closed issue, but I'm curious. How does this work if the user watches the first few episodes or the first season of that show? Will SuggestArr add the next season in line? If this isn't done yet, could this be possible to add? Potentially even monitor the next seasons/releases that aren't up yet if the show was interesting enough for someone to watch the whole thing through?

> > Leaving it blank will request all available seasons.
> 
> > Entering` "1" will monitor only the first season.
> 
> > Entering "3" will monitor the first three seasons.
> 
> > This should give more flexibility over how much content is initially requested. What do you think? If you’re available, I’d really appreciate your help testing this on the nightly tag!
> 
> 
> Sorry to jump in into a closed issue, but I'm curious. How does this work if the user watches the first few episodes or the first season of that show? Will SuggestArr add the next season in line? If this isn't done yet, could this be possible to add? Potentially even monitor the next seasons/releases that aren't up yet if the show was interesting enough for someone to watch the whole thing through?


Hi, thanks for your question! Currently, SuggestArr doesn’t automatically add the next season after a user watches the season, but it’s a great idea. Tracking watched progress or monitoring upcoming seasons could be valuable features. Could you open a new issue for this? It’ll help track the discussion and any future development.

2. Try importing a local user

Display all local users when setting up Overseerr

comments.body: A fix is on the way, thank you for reporting this!

title: [REQ] Recommend based on Netflix viewing history
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
My Plex account only has a small amount of my viewing history due to using multiple services.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I have many years of viewing history and ratings in my Netflix account. I would like this to influence my recommendations by making this information available to SuggestArr.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Exporting the Netflix viewing history and updating/importing into Plex

**Additional context**
Would be great if I could give SuggestArr my Netflix creds and have it import the viewing history.
author: day1118

comments.body: I definitely need to look into this! Right now, I’ve placed the request in low priority, but I absolutely want to find a way to make it happen!

Thank you for your suggestion! Unfortunately, directly importing Netflix viewing history into SuggestArr cannot be implemented at this time. However, an alternative would be to use Trakt to track your watched content. This could serve as a bridge to integrate viewing data across multiple services, including Netflix. I may consider implementing support for this feature in the future!

title: [REQ] Mutliple users
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently SuggestArr  only works with one account. It would be nice if every user of a plex server could utilize SuggestArr  

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Allow users to enroll in SuggestArr and get content downloaded automatically. Maybe use the users account instead of a local user. Maybe also allow for the admin to change the amount of shows and movies per user instead of a global limit

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Multiple instances, but seems rather tedious.

**Additional context**
Maybe make it more transparent how something was downloaded. Maybe add a tag inside radarr/sonarr that it was downloaded via SuggestArr. Also maybe instead of using an local user for requests, use the account of the account of a user to make the request, then use the api to automatically allow it, this would make it more transparent in Overseerr how something got in.
author: daerup

comments.body:
I’ve confirmed that it’s already working! The Plex API returns the viewing history for all users, so SuggestArr will search for content recommendations based on the combined history of all users!

If you loggedin with a Plex admin account in SuggestArr all users history will be scanned.

title: Login failed: 403. No session cookie found.
body:
I normally use login through jellyfin, but i created a separate local user for SuggestArr in Jellyseer. But whenever suggestarr tries to use that account, i just get the error message:
```
2024-10-19 02:16:08,142 - JellyseerClient - ERROR - Login failed: 403. No session cookie found.
2024-10-19 02:16:08,142 - JellyseerClient - ERROR - Error response: {'message': 'Access denied.'}
```
I tried logging into that account in jellyseer and that works without any issues.
Also another problem that is shown here, is that if suggestarr cant login using the provided account, it will just use the api account, which in my case is the admin with auto-approve permissions. So suggestarr just adds a bunch of movies (some which i already have and some that i dont want) automatically to radarr/sonarr without me having the option to disable this behaviour so i have to approve the requests first.
Imo, if a jellyseer is selected to be used and login doesnt work, suggestarr shouldnt use the admin account.

Edit:
Also button to enable/disable suggestarr in the webui would be cool aswell as a dry-run option
author: Joly0

comments.body:
I’ll definitely look into this later, but yes, it’s crucial to block SuggestArr from using the admin account if it can’t log in with the selected user. I’ll make sure to implement that change. Additionally, I’ll work on adding a button in the web UI to enable or disable SuggestArr.

By the way, have you double-checked that the password you entered for the Jellyseer user in SuggestArr is correct? Just to rule out any possible issue with the credentials.

Yes, i made sure the password is correct. Though i am not sure what suggestarr uses to login. I can only select the user, but it looks like login through the username doesnt work for local users, only using mail address

> Yes, i made sure the password is correct. Though i am not sure what suggestarr uses to login. I can only select the user, but it looks like login through the username doesnt work for local users, only using mail address

Hi! Currently, only local accounts without an associated email are supported. This means that your local account only requires a username to log in. I'm working on a fix to improve this process. Thanks for your patience!

title: [REQ] Fetch all library content before request
body: I have a suggestion. When I tried your program now, I saw that it made a lot of requests to jellyseerr for movies that I already have on radarr (they were not added through jellyseerr). Maybe the program could run ai radar and sonar and not make unnecessary requests to jellyseerr?
author: Druidblack

comments.body:
I understand the concern about making unnecessary requests to Jellyseerr for content that’s already in Radarr or Sonarr but wasn’t added through Jellyseerr. While it’s possible to implement such a feature, it would likely become quite complex and would significantly increase the number of API calls and checks required for each suggested content.

However, I can look into adding a feature that would check for content already present in your library that isn’t tracked by Jellyseerr. This might be a simpler and more efficient way to avoid redundant requests.

Let me know your thoughts!

comments.body:
Hello! It looks like the issue may be related to a worker timeout or memory limitations. Could you provide some additional details to help me troubleshoot?

1. What environment are you running the Docker container on (e.g., hardware specifications, available memory, etc.)?
2. How many total TV shows and movies do you currently requested in Jellyseer?

With this information, I can better assist you in resolving the issue. Thanks!

`ciuse99/suggestarr:test
`
Let me know if the issue is resolved or if you encounter any problems.

Thanks in advance!

> 
> 1. Running under Unraid 6.12.10. 16Gb RAM. 
> 
> 2. 289 TV Shows

Hi! Should be solved in the latest tag.

title: Make an image for dockerhub
body: Good afternoon. Is it possible in the future to create an image for dockerhub so that users can receive a ready-made image without creating it in detail? So that you can then receive updates by replacing the image.
author: Druidblack

comments.body:
Hi! Thank you for your suggestion.

The good news is that the Docker image for the project is already available on Docker Hub! You can pull it directly without needing to build it yourself.

To get the latest version of the image, you can run the following command:

`docker pull ciuse99/suggestarr:latest`

After that, you can create and run the container using Docker Compose or `docker run`.

Let me know if you have any questions!

Hi @Druidblack,

Could you clarify your request a bit more? I’d like to better understand your needs so I can address this properly. 

Looking forward to your clarification so I can explore this further and close the issue.

title: Requested for movies that's already available
body: Requested for movies that's already available. It should only request for items that are missing.
author: trashken

comments.body: Hi! Thank you for bringing this to my attention. This feature is already implemented, but it seems like there might be an issue with its functionality. I'll be investigating the problem today and working on a fix to ensure that only missing items are requested. Appreciate your patience!
Fixed in the last version :)

title: Cron Customisation & Enhanced Logging
body:
Ability to use a environment variable to determine the cronjob in which the script runs. It's very hard to indicate if the script is working without looking at the repository and the Dockerfile to figure out it's cron based.

It may also be worth making it an option to be able to have the script run initially on container start and give people the ability to enable/disable this via an environment variable, as some might like to use docker scripts externally to restart at very bespoke cron timings. 

I also suggest making some type of initialisation message too, as people adding this from the unraid store will not have much context as to why things aren't working and believe the app is broken as there is no ouput.
author: JamsRepos

comments.body:
Thank you for your valuable suggestions! I have recently made significant updates to the project. A web interface has been implemented to enhance the management of the automation process. Users can now specify a custom cron schedule either through environment variables or directly via the front-end interface, providing greater flexibility in how the script operates.

Additionally, I've added a "Force Run" button on the web page, allowing users to manually initiate the process after setting the environment variables. This feature offers more control over the automation workflow.

Looking ahead, I also plan to implement a welcome message in the terminal output. This will provide users with clear feedback on the script's execution status, helping to clarify any potential confusion regarding its operation.

I appreciate your input and am committed to making the project as user-friendly as possible. If you have any more ideas or questions, feel free to reach out!
